description:
• Please note, sponsorship is not available for this role.

Come join us!

Oracle Digital Government group is on a mission to support national governments on their digital transformation journey. If you have experience bringing AI models to production, cloud knowledge, and/or have a passion for, we would like to hear from you. We are growing our dedicated team so come join us on this exciting journey.

We are searching for an experienced Lead Data Scientist to:
• Collaborate with engineering to build pipelines and tools for data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, model deployment, and improvement.
• Use machine learning, data mining, statistical techniques, and others to create actionable, meaningful, and scalable solutions to solve complex government challenges
• Identify meaningful insights from complex data sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings to engineering teams and leadership
• Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes to boost team productivity, such as model development, model validation, and model implementation.

Responsibilities:
• Work closely with business teams and customers to understand business requirements, and implement new data science-driven insights.
• Work with other Engineers to validate that data from internal and external sources is relevant, trustworthy and actionable and ensure the platform provides required data and level of granularity for advanced Data Science projects to augment Cloud applications and provide Management Insights.
• Design and implement algorithms, train models, and operationalize models to production for ingestion by other SaaS services and continuously improve models. Experience with Python is required.
• Design innovative predictive models, optimization models, experiments, and model performance testing.
• Address business/customer problems and questions using statistical and data science techniques to achieve business goals and KPI's. Come up with innovative solutions to address tradeoffs or challenges faced by teams.
• Perform ad hoc and in-depth analyses and then surface/report insights through dashboards & visualizations. Experience with Analytics tools such as Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) or Tableau
• Provide proactive leadership, demonstrating self-sufficiency, influencing, and team-building skills while creating and socializing innovative data science-driven solutions.

Qualifications:
• Bachelors or Masters in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Economics or a related field.
• 7+ years’ experience in analytics & applying data science to solving real-world problems. Public Sector or Government is a plus
• Experience with data science programming languages such as R and Python.
• Experience in querying and manipulating data for analysis — EDA, statistics, and visualizations.
• Must have experience with Oracle suite of Cloud products and services including Oracle DB, Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), Oracle Analytics Cloud(OAC), and Oracle Data Science Services..
• Must have experience working with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure or large industry cloud environment, with an understanding of SaaS services, telemetry and impacts of application environment behavior over time.
• Experience with machine learning workflows in a production environment.
• Experience with data modeling, machine learning algorithms, optimization, and data science techniques e.g. decision trees, SVM, neural networks, time series, forecasting, classification, regression, clustering, cross-validation, and model evaluation.

We care:

At Oracle, we don’t just value differences—we celebrate them. We’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people work together. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion.

https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/culture/diversity.html

#LI-REMOTE
